amendment.description: Amendment sought to reduce funding for Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy Programs by $22 million; Nuclear Energy Programs by $9,810,000; Fossil Energy Research and Development by $30,935,000; Department of Energy Departmental Administration by $9,551,000; Salaries and Expenses for Nuclear Regulatory Commission by $49,062,000 and apply the savings of $121,358,000 to the spending reduction account.
amendment.purpose: An amendment to reduce funds for Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy Programs by $22 million; Nuclear Energy Programs by $9,810,000; Fossil Energy Research and Development by $30,935,000; Department of Energy Departmental Administration by $9,551,000; Salaries and Expenses for Nuclear Regulatory Commission by $49,062,000 and to apply $121,358,000 to the spending reduction account.

vote.text: On agreeing to the McClintock amendment (A022) Failed by recorded vote: 129 - 290 (Roll no. 379).

action.text: Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the McClintock amendment (A022) Failed by recorded vote: 129 - 290 (Roll no. 379).
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A022) offered by Mr. McClintock.
